info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fulton, southeastern Herkimer and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Little Falls, moving east southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Johnstown, Herkimer, Little Falls, Canajoharie, Fonda, Fort Plain, Dolgeville, St. Johnsville, Ephratah, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Caroga Lake, Oppenheim, Fairfield, Berkshire, Fultonville, Palatine Bridge, Nelliston, Bleecker and Ingham Mills. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 28 and 29A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
